This was a stop after visiting Parc Guell.  As we've done in almost all the places we've visited in Barcelona, we chose to sit at the bar, order a beer and a few tapas and pintxos.  Their version of patatas bravas was a bit on the dry side and their pan tomate was soggier than what I would have liked.  The star of their menu is definitely their many versions of "pepitas."  We ordered the "Golden Pepita" which came with a tender slice of beef and foie gras - this was delicious.  Other than that, I don't think the location or the menu is something I would necessarily return to or recommend.  It was located in a larger street and not necessarily in a smaller, tucked away part of the street that truly adds to the romantic dining experience in Barcelona.
